titleStmt.title: Instructions lately agreed on by the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament, for the commissioners sent by them to the Hague, unto the Kings most Excellent Majesty. Together with the speech made thereupon by the honorable Denzell Holles esq; one of the commissioners, on Wednesday the 16th day of May, 1660. Now published for the taking off and disproving those false reports raised by some malicious persons, as if he had gone beyond his commission, and the said instructions.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Robert Clavel at the Stags-head in St. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The verso of the first leaf contains a woodcut of the royal arms.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Stags-head in St. Pauls Church-yard
